summary: BRAKES WORKING IMPROPERLY CAUSING DAMAGE TO ROTORS.  BRAKE PADS NOT WORN, BUT ROTORS CHEWED UP AND PEELING APART.  INSIDE SURFACE OF FRONT ROTORS FLAKED AND SCALED OFF IN LARGE SECTIONS.  1999 CHEVROLET SILVERADO WITH 44,900 MILEAGE. AFTER NEW ROTORS CALIPER AND BRAKE PADS INSTALLED, BRAKES BEGIN GRABBING AND VIBRATING.  TOOK TRUCK TO DEALER WHO DID ADDITIONAL RESURFACING OF NEW FRONT ROTORS, REMOVED AND REPLACED FRONT WHEEL SENSOR.  MECHANICS REVEALED THAT THERE HAVE BEEN MANY OTHER OWNERS WITH BRAKE PROBLEMS ON THESE VEHICLES, BUT GM HAS DONE NOTHING AS YET.  *NLM
